title: Use uploaded MauiLaneCareHome-4.jpg as logo on login page and header

requirements.text: Add the uploaded image file "MauiLaneCareHome-4.jpg" to the frontend static assets so it is served reliably in IC deployments (place it under frontend/public/assets/generated/).

quotes: use this uploaded image as logo for the login page and the header

acceptanceCriteria: The file exists at frontend/public/assets/generated/MauiLaneCareHome-4.jpg in the codebase.
The image is accessible at runtime via the app’s BASE_URL-prefixed path (no 404 in browser network panel).

requirements.text: Update the branding configuration so the global logo path points to "assets/generated/MauiLaneCareHome-4.jpg" (replacing the current logo path) so BrandLogo renders this uploaded image everywhere it is used.

quotes: use this uploaded image as logo for the login page and the header

acceptanceCriteria: No other code path overrides the logo on the login screen or header.

requirements.text: Ensure the login/sign-in screen (ProtectedGate) and the authenticated header (MauiAppShell) display the uploaded logo image via the existing BrandLogo component, without regressions to sizing or fallback behavior.

quotes: use this uploaded image as logo for the login page and the header

acceptanceCriteria: When logged out, the login card shows MauiLaneCareHome-4.jpg as the large logo (no initials fallback unless the image fails to load).
When logged in, the sticky header shows MauiLaneCareHome-4.jpg as the small logo.
No broken-image icon appears on either screen in a production build.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend.immutablePaths (including frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, and frontend/src/components/ui).
Keep logo loading compatible with Internet Computer BASE_URL (continue using BrandLogo’s BASE_URL resolution behavior).
nonGoals: Fixing the known issue where deleted residents reappear after a new sign-in/login (not requested in this change).
Changing favicon, PWA manifest icons, or other brand assets beyond the login page and authenticated header logo.
